TEXT.English: [TAB]Land may refer to: The part of the Earth that is not covered by water. Terrestrial ecoregion, an ecoregion based on soil instead of water.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La terre peut faire référence à : la partie du sol qui n'est pas couverte par l'eau. Il s'agit d'une écorégion terrestre basée sur un sol ferme et non sur de l'eau
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff 'Land' kann sich auf den Teil der Erde beziehen, der nicht von Wasser überzogen ist bzw. ein ökologisches System, dass auf Grundboden basiert anstatt auf Wasser.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Land may refer to: The part of the Earth that is not covered by water. Terrestrial ecoregion, an ecoregion based on soil instead of water.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Land may refer to: The part of the Earth that is not covered by water. Terrestrial ecoregion, an ecoregion based on soil instead of water.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Water is a chemical substance with the chemical formula H2O. Its molecule contains one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms connected by covalent bonds. Water is a liquid at ambient conditions, but it often co-exists on Earth with its solid state, ice, and gaseous state (water vapor or steam). Water also exists in a liquid crystal state near hydrophilic surfaces.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'eau est un composé chimique ubiquitaire sur la Terre, essentiel pour tous les organismes vivants connus. C'est le milieu de vie de la plupart des êtres vivants. Elle se trouve en général dans son état liquide répondant à la formule chimique H2O : la molécule contient un atome d'oxygène et deux atomes d'hydrogène.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Wasser ist eine chemische Substanz mit der Formel H2O. Es enthält also Sauerstoff und Wasserstoff. Bei Raumtemperatur ist es flüssig, existiert aber auf der Erde auch oft in gefrorener Form als Eis oder Schnee oder in Gasform als Wasserdampf.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Water is a chemical substance with the chemical formula H2O. Its molecule contains one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms connected by covalent bonds. Water is a liquid at ambient conditions, but it often co-exists on Earth with its solid state, ice, and gaseous state (water vapor or steam). Water also exists in a liquid crystal state near hydrophilic surfaces.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Water is a chemical substance with the chemical formula H2O. Its molecule contains one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms connected by covalent bonds. Water is a liquid at ambient conditions, but it often co-exists on Earth with its solid state, ice, and gaseous state (water vapor or steam). Water also exists in a liquid crystal state near hydrophilic surfaces.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lodges[COLOR_REVERT] can be built in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forests[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK] and [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungle[\LINK]. The production of [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK] there is increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A small, makeshift or crude shelter or habitation, as of boughs, poles, skins, earth, or rough boards; cabin or hut.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un abri est un logement temporaire dont a besoin pour répondre aux besoins naturels de sécurité, d'hygiène et de confort. Il peut prendre la forme d'une cabine ou d'une hutte.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein kleines Gebäude, eine kleine Hütte oder ein behelfsmässiger Unterschlupf.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A small, makeshift or crude shelter or habitation, as of boughs, poles, skins, earth, or rough boards; cabin or hut.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A small, makeshift or crude shelter or habitation, as of boughs, poles, skins, earth, or rough boards; cabin or hut.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Lumberjack Camps[COLOR_REVERT] are the upgrades of [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges[\LINK], that can be built in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forests[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK] and [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungle[\LINK]. The production of [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK] there is increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A small, makeshift or crude shelter or habitation, as of boughs, poles, skins, earth, or rough boards; cabin or hut.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein kleines Gebäude, eine kleine Hütte oder ein behelfsmässiger Unterschlupf.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A small, makeshift or crude shelter or habitation, as of boughs, poles, skins, earth, or rough boards; cabin or hut.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ruins[COLOR_REVERT] are the remnants of a city or improvement that has been abandoned or destroyed. They do not serve any in-game function other than decoration.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ruins are the remains of human-made architecture: structures that were once complete, as time went by, have fallen into a state of partial or complete disrepair, due to lack of maintenance or deliberate acts of destruction. Disasters, war and depopulation are the most common root causes, with many structures becoming progressively derelict over time due to long-term weathering and scavenging.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les ruines sont les restes d'architecture humaine passée : des structures autrefois complètes qui, par abandon, se sont désagrégés pour atteindre un état difficilement réparable. Les désastres naturels, la guerre ou le dépeuplement sont les causes principales de tels abandons. Les conditions climatiques et le pillage sont les principales causes de délabrement de ces structures.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ruinen sind die Reste menschlicher Architektur: Strukturen, die einst vollständig waren, dann aber durch den Einfluss der Umwelt, wie Pflanzen, Regen oder Wind, über die Zeit zerfielen. Gründe für die Verwahrlosung können Kriege, Katastrophen Disasters, Krankheiten und vieles mehr gewesen sein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ruins are the remains of human-made architecture: structures that were once complete, as time went by, have fallen into a state of partial or complete disrepair, due to lack of maintenance or deliberate acts of destruction. Disasters, war and depopulation are the most common root causes, with many structures becoming progressively derelict over time due to long-term weathering and scavenging.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Ruins are the remains of human-made architecture: structures that were once complete, as time went by, have fallen into a state of partial or complete disrepair, due to lack of maintenance or deliberate acts of destruction. Disasters, war and depopulation are the most common root causes, with many structures becoming progressively derelict over time due to long-term weathering and scavenging.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hut may refer to: Hut (dwelling), a small and crude shelter.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une hutte fait référence à un petit abri d'habitation précaire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine 'Hütte' kann ein kleiner behälfsmässiger Unterschlupf oder dessen Ruine sein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Hut may refer to: Hut (dwelling), a small and crude shelter.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Hut may refer to: Hut (dwelling), a small and crude shelter.

TEXT.English: Ancient Ruins
TEXT.German: Antike Ruinen

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ancient Ruins[COLOR_REVERT] you can often find treasures, useful information or even units. Beware though: the natives regard them as sacred, and they may not approve of you looting the graves of their ancestors. Only [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Seasoned Scouts[\LINK] are experienced enough to not invoke their ire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ruins are the remains of human-made architecture: structures that were once complete, as time went by, have fallen into a state of partial or complete disrepair, due to lack of maintenance or deliberate acts of destruction. Natural disaster, war and depopulation are the most common root causes, with many structures becoming progressively derelict over time due to long-term weathering and scavenging.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les ruines sont les restes d'architecture humaine passée : des structures autrefois complètes qui, par abandon, se sont désagrégés pour atteindre un état difficilement réparable. Les désastres naturels, la guerre ou le dépeuplement sont les causes principales de tels abandons. Les conditions climatiques et le pillage sont les principales causes de délabrement de ces structures.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ruinen sind die Reste menschlicher Architektur: Strukturen, die einst vollständig waren, dann aber durch den Einfluss der Umwelt, wie Pflanzen, Regen oder Wind, über die Zeit zerfielen. Gründe für die Verwahrlosung können Kriege, Katastrophen Disasters, Krankheiten und vieles mehr gewesen sein. In diesen Ruinen können sich manchmal noch wertvolle Dinge befinden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ruins are the remains of human-made architecture: structures that were once complete, as time went by, have fallen into a state of partial or complete disrepair, due to lack of maintenance or deliberate acts of destruction. Natural disaster, war and depopulation are the most common root causes, with many structures becoming progressively derelict over time due to long-term weathering and scavenging.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Ruins are the remains of human-made architecture: structures that were once complete, as time went by, have fallen into a state of partial or complete disrepair, due to lack of maintenance or deliberate acts of destruction. Natural disaster, war and depopulation are the most common root causes, with many structures becoming progressively derelict over time due to long-term weathering and scavenging.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]In [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Burial Grounds[COLOR_REVERT] you can often find treasures, useful information or even units. Beware though: the natives regard them as sacred, and they may not approve of you looting the graves of their ancestors. Only [LINK=UNIT_SCOUT]Seasoned Scouts[\LINK] are experienced enough to not invoke their ire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A burial ground or cemetery is a spatially defined area where the remains of deceased people are buried or are otherwise interred. The term "cemetery" implies that the land is specifically designated as a burial ground. The intact or cremated remains of deceased people may be interred. The remains may be interred in a grave, commonly referred to as burial, or may be interred in a tomb, an "above-ground grave" (resembling a sarcophagus), a mausoleum, columbarium, or other edifice. In Western cultures, funeral ceremonies are often observed in cemeteries. These ceremonies or rites of passage differ according to cultural practices and religious beliefs. Modern cemeteries often include crematoria, and some grounds previously used for both, continue as crematoria as a principal use long after the interment areas have been filled.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un cimetière est un endroit spécifiquement dédié au repos des personnes décédés. Ces dernières sont généralement enterrées ou incinérées.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Begräbnisstätte oder ein Friedhof sind Orte, an denen Verstorbene begraben werden. In manchen Kulturen war und ist es üblich den Toten reiche Grabbeigaben mitzugeben. Sie gelten in den meisten Kulturen als geheiligte Orte.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A burial ground or cemetery is a spatially defined area where the remains of deceased people are buried or are otherwise interred. The term "cemetery" implies that the land is specifically designated as a burial ground. The intact or cremated remains of deceased people may be interred. The remains may be interred in a grave, commonly referred to as burial, or may be interred in a tomb, an "above-ground grave" (resembling a sarcophagus), a mausoleum, columbarium, or other edifice. In Western cultures, funeral ceremonies are often observed in cemeteries. These ceremonies or rites of passage differ according to cultural practices and religious beliefs. Modern cemeteries often include crematoria, and some grounds previously used for both, continue as crematoria as a principal use long after the interment areas have been filled.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A burial ground or cemetery is a spatially defined area where the remains of deceased people are buried or are otherwise interred. The term "cemetery" implies that the land is specifically designated as a burial ground. The intact or cremated remains of deceased people may be interred. The remains may be interred in a grave, commonly referred to as burial, or may be interred in a tomb, an "above-ground grave" (resembling a sarcophagus), a mausoleum, columbarium, or other edifice. In Western cultures, funeral ceremonies are often observed in cemeteries. These ceremonies or rites of passage differ according to cultural practices and religious beliefs. Modern cemeteries often include crematoria, and some grounds previously used for both, continue as crematoria as a principal use long after the interment areas have been filled.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ship Wreckages[COLOR_REVERT] are scattered across the Ocean. Maps, gold and even survivors of the crew might be found among the wreckage.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A shipwreck is the remains of a ship that has wrecked. Shipwrecks are found either beached (on land) or sunk (at the bottom of a body of water). Whatever the cause, a sunken ship or a wrecked ship is a physical example of the event: this explains why the two concepts are often overlapping in English. The United Nations estimates that there are more than 3 million shipwrecks on the ocean floor.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Dans le domaine maritime, une épave est ce qui reste d'un navire en mer (épave dérivante), sur le rivage ou au fond de la mer, après qu'il a été abandonné, qu'il s'est échoué ou a coulé, à la suite d'un « événement de mer » (naufrage, avarie, collision, erreur de navigation, etc.) ou d'un sabordage. L' UNESCO évalue à 3 millions leur nombre total, mais dont à peine un millier seraient rentables économiquement.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Unter einem Schiffswrack versteht man die überreste eines verunglückten Schiffes. Manchmal kann man darin noch wertvolle Dinge finden. Ist man schnell Genug am Ort des Unglücks, gelingt es vielleicht sogar überlebenede zu retten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A shipwreck is the remains of a ship that has wrecked. Shipwrecks are found either beached (on land) or sunk (at the bottom of a body of water). Whatever the cause, a sunken ship or a wrecked ship is a physical example of the event: this explains why the two concepts are often overlapping in English. The United Nations estimates that there are more than 3 million shipwrecks on the ocean floor.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A shipwreck is the remains of a ship that has wrecked. Shipwrecks are found either beached (on land) or sunk (at the bottom of a body of water). Whatever the cause, a sunken ship or a wrecked ship is a physical example of the event: this explains why the two concepts are often overlapping in English. The United Nations estimates that there are more than 3 million shipwrecks on the ocean floor.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Farms[COLOR_REVERT] can be built on all flat, unvegetated [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grassland[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK] terrain. The production of [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] there is increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A farm is an area of land, including various structures, devoted primarily to the practice of producing and managing food (produce, grains, or livestock), fibres and, increasingly, fuel. It is the basic production facility in food production. Farms may be owned and operated by a single individual, family, community, corporation or a company. A farm can be a holding of any size from a fraction of a hectare to several thousand hectares.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une ferme, ou exploitation agricole, est une entreprise (ou partie d'une entreprise) constituée en vue de la production agricole et caractérisée par une gestion unique et des moyens de production propres.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Farm ist ein Stück Land, dass verschiedenste Gebäude und Anbauflächen beinhalten kann, aber primär der Produktion von Nahrung dient. Oft in Form von Getreideanbau oder Viehzucht. Der Begriff 'Farm' sagt allerdings noch nichts über die Grösse aus, die von sehr klein, bis geradezu reisig variieren kann.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A farm is an area of land, including various structures, devoted primarily to the practice of producing and managing food (produce, grains, or livestock), fibres and, increasingly, fuel. It is the basic production facility in food production. Farms may be owned and operated by a single individual, family, community, corporation or a company. A farm can be a holding of any size from a fraction of a hectare to several thousand hectares.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A farm is an area of land, including various structures, devoted primarily to the practice of producing and managing food (produce, grains, or livestock), fibres and, increasingly, fuel. A farm can be a holding of any size from a fraction of a hectare to several thousand hectares.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A fishing vessel is a boat or ship used to catch fish in the sea, or on a lake or river. Many different kinds of vessels are used in commercial, artisanal and recreational fishing.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un bateau de pêche est un navire pratiquant la pêche. En général, le nom d'un type de bateaux est relation avec la pêche qu'il pratique, type de poissons ou technique utilisée.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Fischerboot ist ein kleines Seegefährt, dass entlang der Küste, in Flüssen oder in Seen zum Fischfang genutzt werden kann.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A fishing vessel is a boat or ship used to catch fish in the sea, or on a lake or river. Many different kinds of vessels are used in commercial, artisanal and recreational fishing.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A fishing vessel is a boat or ship used to catch fish in the sea, or on a lake or river. Many different kinds of vessels are used in commercial, artisanal and recreational fishing.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mines[COLOR_REVERT] can be built on all unvegetated Hills and Peaks, as well as on [LINK=TERRAIN_DESERT]Desert[\LINK] terrain. Mines increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Ore[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]Rock Salt[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SILVER]Silver[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]Gems[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]Gold[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Mine or mines can refer to: Mining, extraction of mineral resources from the ground.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une mine est un gisement exploité de matériaux (par exemple d'or, d'argent, de diamants, de fer, de sel, etc.). Elle peut être à ciel ouvert ou souterraine.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff 'Miene' bezieht sich auf eine Abbaufläche für Metalle, Edelsteine oder Mineralien. Eine Miene kann sowohl oberirdisch, wie auch unterirdisch angelegt sein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mine or mines can refer to: Mining, extraction of mineral resources from the ground.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Mine or mines can refer to: Mining, extraction of mineral resources from the ground.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Large Mines[COLOR_REVERT] are the upgrades of [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_MINE]Mines[\LINK]. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Ore[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_RAW_SALT]Rock Salt[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SILVER]Silver[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_GEMS]Gems[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_GOLD]Gold[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Mine or mines can refer to: Mining, extraction of mineral resources from the ground.

TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mine or mines can refer to: Mining, extraction of mineral resources from the ground.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Mine or mines can refer to: Mining, extraction of mineral resources from the ground.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Plantations[COLOR_REVERT] can be built on all flat, unvegetated [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grassland[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK] terrain. The production of all goods other than [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Livestock[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] or [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] there is increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A plantation is a large artificially established forest, farm or estate, where crops are grown for sale, often in distant markets rather than for local on-site consumption. The term plantation is informal and not precisely defined.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une plantation est une exploitation agricole en monoculture de cultures à forte valeur économique destinées à la vente vers des marchés internationaux. La plantation est souvent associée à certaines cultures tels le coton, la canne à sucre, le tabac, le café, la banane, le cacao ou le chanvre.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Plantage ist üblicherweise ein grösseres Anbaugebiet von Pflanzen für den Verkauf oder deren Weiterverarbeitung.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A plantation is a large artificially established forest, farm or estate, where crops are grown for sale, often in distant markets rather than for local on-site consumption. The term plantation is informal and not precisely defined.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A plantation is a large artificially established forest, farm or estate, where crops are grown for sale, often in distant markets rather than for local on-site consumption. The term plantation is informal and not precisely defined.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Large Plantations[COLOR_REVERT] are upgraded versions of the [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_PLANTATION]Plantation[\LINK]. The production of all goods other than [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Livestock[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] or [LINK=YIELD_BARLEY]Barley[\LINK] there is increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A plantation is a large artificially established forest, farm or estate, where crops are grown for sale, often in distant markets rather than for local on-site consumption. The term plantation is informal and not precisely defined.

La plantation est souvent associée à certaines cultures tels le coton, la canne à sucre, le tabac, le café, la banane, le cacao ou le chanvre.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Quarries[COLOR_REVERT] can be built only on Peaks. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_STONE]Stone[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A quarry is a type of open-pit mine from which rock or minerals are extracted. Quarries are generally used for extracting building materials, such as dimension stone, construction aggregate, riprap, sand, and gravel. They are often colocated with concrete and asphalt plants due to the requirement for large amounts of aggregate in those materials. The word quarry can include underground quarrying for stone, such as Bath stone.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une carrière est un endroit d'où sont extraits des matériaux de construction à partir de roche. Le chantier se fait à ciel ouvert, soit « à flanc de coteau », soit « en fosse » (jusqu'à une centaine de mètres de profondeur parfois). Les carrières exploitent des roches meubles (éboulis, alluvionnaires) ou massives (roches consolidées sédimentaire (calcaires et grès), éruptive ou métamorphique (granites, porphyres, gneiss, amphibolites, quartzites, schistes, basaltes.).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Steinbruch ist meist eine grubenähnliche Anlage, die dazu dient Fels oder Mineralien abzubauen. In vielen Fällen dient dieses Gestein als Baumaterial.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A quarry is a type of open-pit mine from which rock or minerals are extracted. Quarries are generally used for extracting building materials, such as dimension stone, construction aggregate, riprap, sand, and gravel. They are often colocated with concrete and asphalt plants due to the requirement for large amounts of aggregate in those materials. The word quarry can include underground quarrying for stone, such as Bath stone.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A quarry is a type of open-pit mine from which rock or minerals are extracted. Quarries are generally used for extracting building materials, such as dimension stone, construction aggregate, riprap, sand, and gravel. They are often colocated with concrete and asphalt plants due to the requirement for large amounts of aggregate in those materials. The word quarry can include underground quarrying for stone, such as Bath stone.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Large Quarries[COLOR_REVERT] are the upgrades of [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_QUARRY]Quarries[\LINK]. They increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_STONE]Stone[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A quarry is a type of open-pit mine from which rock or minerals are extracted. Quarries are generally used for extracting building materials, such as dimension stone, construction aggregate, riprap, sand, and gravel. They are often colocated with concrete and asphalt plants due to the requirement for large amounts of aggregate in those materials. The word quarry can include underground quarrying for stone, such as Bath stone.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une carrière est un endroit d'où sont extraits des matériaux de construction à partir de roche. Le chantier se fait à ciel ouvert, soit « à flanc de coteau », soit « en fosse » (jusqu'à une centaine de mètres de profondeur parfois). Les carrières exploitent des roches meubles (éboulis, alluvionnaires) ou massives (roches consolidées sédimentaire (calcaires et grès), éruptive ou métamorphique (granites, porphyres, gneiss, amphibolites, quartzites, schistes, basaltes.).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Steinbruch ist meist eine grubenähnliche Anlage, die dazu dient Fels oder Mineralien abzubauen. In vielen Fällen dient dieses Gestein als Baumaterial.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A quarry is a type of open-pit mine from which rock or minerals are extracted. Quarries are generally used for extracting building materials, such as dimension stone, construction aggregate, riprap, sand, and gravel. They are often colocated with concrete and asphalt plants due to the requirement for large amounts of aggregate in those materials. The word quarry can include underground quarrying for stone, such as Bath stone.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pastures[COLOR_REVERT] can be built on unvegetated terrain that is either flat or hilly, and where [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Livestock[\LINK] can be bred. The production of [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK] is increased on those tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pasture is land with vegetation cover used for grazing of livestock as part of a farm, or in ranching or other unenclosed pastoral systems or used by wild animals for grazing or browsing. Prior to the advent of factory farming, pasture was the primary source of food for grazing animals such as cattle and horses. It is still used extensively, particularly in arid regions where pasture land is unsuitable for any other agricultural production. In more humid regions, pasture grazing is exploited extensively for free range and organic farming.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le pâturage est une forme d'alimentation des animaux herbivores qui se nourrissent de plantes (telles que les graminées). Le pâturage diffère de la prédation parce que l'organisme mangé n'est généralement pas tué, et du parasitisme parce que les deux organismes n'ont pas de relation symbiotique et que le « brouteur » n'est généralement pas limité dans le choix des espèces qu'il peut consommer (voir espèces généraliste et spécialisée).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als 'Weideland' bezeichnet man Flächen mit Vegetation, die der Viehzucht dienen. Oft gehören diese Flächen zu einer Farm oder einer Ranch. In vielen Fällen dient dazu Land, dass ansonsten für den Anbau von Nutzpflanzen nicht geeignet ist.

In more humid regions, pasture grazing is exploited extensively for free range and organic farming.

TEXT.English: A winery is a building or property that produces wine, or a business involved in the production of wine, such as a wine company. Some wine companies own many wineries. Besides wine making equipment, larger wineries may also feature warehouses, bottling lines, laboratories, and large expanses of tanks known as tank farms. The oldest winery in the world found to date is a 6,000 year old winery in the Areni region of Armenia, which is still a wine making region today.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les vignes sont des lianes de la famille des Vitaceae. Ce sont des plantes du genre Vitis largement cultivées pour leur fruit en grappes, le raisin, dont on tire un jus, le moût, qui devient du vin après fermentation. Ce sont des arbrisseaux grimpants qui s'attachent aux supports par des vrilles. Les tiges ligneuses, appelées sarments, taillées en culture, peuvent atteindre dans la nature de très grandes longueurs en grimpant dans les arbres. Les feuilles à nervure palmée comportent cinq lobes principaux plus ou moins découpés, et sont en forme de cour à la base. Elles connaissent une importante polymorphie selon les cépages et espèces.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Weinberg oder ein Weinanbaugebiet ist ein Areal das dem Weinanbau gewidmet ist. Meist wurden dazu sonnige Hanglagen genutzt. Die ältesten Weinanbaugebiete, die man je fand lagen in Armenien und sind fast 6000 Jahre alt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A winery is a building or property that produces wine, or a business involved in the production of wine, such as a wine company. Some wine companies own many wineries. Besides wine making equipment, larger wineries may also feature warehouses, bottling lines, laboratories, and large expanses of tanks known as tank farms. The oldest winery in the world found to date is a 6,000 year old winery in the Areni region of Armenia, which is still a wine making region today.

The oldest winery in the world found to date is a 6,000 year old winery in the Areni region of Armenia, which is still a wine making region today.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forts[COLOR_REVERT] only work if a [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Military Unit[\LINK] is stationed inside. To do this, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fortify[COLOR_REVERT] a military unit on the plot where the Fort is located.[NEWLINE]For more information on working Forts, see [LINK=CONCEPT_FORTS]Forts[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Fortifications are military constructions and buildings designed for defence in warfare and military bases. Humans have constructed defensive works for many thousands of years, in a variety of increasingly complex designs. The term is derived from the Latin fortis (strong) and facere (to make).
TEXT.French: [TAB]La fortification (du latin fortificatio « action de fortifier ») est l'art militaire de renforcer une position ou un lieu par des ouvrages de défense en prévision de leur éventuelle attaque par un ennemi hostile. Par extension, la fortification désigne ces ouvrages de défense eux-mêmes.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forts[COLOR_REVERT] sind nur aktiv, wenn eine [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Militäreinheit[\LINK] darin stattioniert ist. Dafür muss diese Einheit in dem Fort [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]befestigt[COLOR_REVERT] werden.[NEWLINE]Für weitere Informationen siehe [LINK=CONCEPT_FORTS]Forts[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Befestigungen sind Konstruktionen mit militärischen Zweck oder dienen schlicht der Verteidigung vor Feinden. Defensive Anlagen wurden von der Menschheit schon seit tausenden von Jahren geschaffen. Der Begriff 'Fort' leitet sich vom Lateinischen Wort 'fortis' ab, welches übersetzt 'stark' bedeutet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Fortifications are military constructions and buildings designed for defence in warfare and military bases. Humans have constructed defensive works for many thousands of years, in a variety of increasingly complex designs. The term is derived from the Latin fortis (strong) and facere (to make).

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] only work once they are inhabited by monks. To do this, a colonist with the [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionary[\LINK] profession needs to be fortified on the plot with the Monastery. Employing [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuit Missionaries[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]Evangelists[\LINK] increase the effectiveness of the Monastery.[NEWLINE]For more information on working Monasteries, see [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]Monasteries[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Monastery denotes the building, or complex of buildings, comprising the domestic quarters and workplace(s) of monastics, whether monks or nuns, and whether living in community or alone (hermits). The monastery generally includes a place reserved for prayer which may be a chapel, church or temple, and may also serve as an oratory. A monastery complex typically comprises a number of buildings which include a church, dormitory, cloister, refectory, library, balneary and infirmary. Depending on the location, the monastic order and the occupation of its inhabitants, the complex may also include a wide range of buildings that facilitate self-sufficiency and service to the community. These may include a hospice, a school and a range of agricultural and manufacturing buildings such as a barn, a forge or a brewery.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un monastère (du grec monos, « seul ») est un ensemble de bâtiments où habite une communauté religieuse de moines ou de moniales. On parle également d'abbaye s'il est dirigé par un abbé ou de prieuré s'il est dépendant ou de moindre importance. Souvent, le prieuré est dépendant d'une abbaye ou monastère. Les monastères des ordres militaires du Moyen âge sont appelés commanderies. On parle de couvent pour les résidences de Franciscains et Dominicains, ainsi que d'autres ordres, tandis que les Bénédictins ou Prémontrés habitent des abbayes ou prieurés.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ein [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kloster[COLOR_REVERT] ist nur aktiv, wenn Mönche darin leben. Dafür muss ein Kolonist im Beruf [LINK=PROFESSION_MISSIONARY]Missionar[\LINK] im Kloster befestigt werden. Wird ein [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY]Jesuiten Missionar[\LINK] ode einr [LINK=UNIT_CHRISTIAN_MISSIONARY_PROT]Evangelist[\LINK] eingesetzt, erhöht sich die Effektivität des Klosters.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Für weitere Informationen siehe [LINK=CONCEPT_MONASTERIES]Klöster[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der Begriff 'Kloster' steht für ein Gebäude oder einen Komplex mehrerer Gebäude, welches üblicherweise von Mönchen oder Nonnen bewohnt wird. Ein Kloster beinhaltet üblicherweise Gebetsstellen, wie eine Kapelle, eine Kirche oder einen Tempel, aber auch Räume oder Gebäude für den Alltag und die Selbstversorgung, wie einen Schlafsaal, Speisesaal, Werkstellen, Scheunen, Schmieden und manchmal Brauereien. In manchen größeren Klöstern findet man auch Büchereien, Schulen oder Krankenhäuser, die dann auch oft den umliegenden Gemeinden Dienste anbieten.

The monastery generally includes a place reserved for prayer which may be a chapel, church or temple, and may also serve as an oratory. A monastery complex typically comprises a number of buildings which include a church, dormitory, cloister, refectory, library, balneary and infirmary. Depending on the location, the monastic order and the occupation of its inhabitants, the complex may also include a wide range of buildings that facilitate self-sufficiency and service to the community. These may include a hospice, a school and a range of agricultural and manufacturing buildings such as a barn, a forge or a brewery.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Collector's Posts[COLOR_REVERT] can be built only on hilly [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK] terrain. The [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_RED_PEPPER]Red Pepper[\LINK] production on such tiles is increased.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1](dwelling) Building use for collecting holding food animals tools etc.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les piments font partie de l'alimentation des Amériques depuis au moins 9 500 ans. Des traces archéologiques de domestication ont été trouvées dans le sud-ouest de l'équateur il y a plus de 6 000 ans. Le piment semble avoir été une des premières plantes cultivées autogames en Amérique centrale et du Sud.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Sammelstelle ist ein Gebäude, dass der Zwischenlagerung von Gütern für ihren Weitertransport dient.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Grasslands are areas where the vegetation is dominated by grasses (Poaceae) and other herbaceous (non-woody) plants (forbs). However, sedge (Cyperaceae) and rush (Juncaceae) families can also be found. Grasslands occur naturally on all continents except Antarctica. In temperate latitudes, such as northwest Europe and the Great Plains and California in North America, native grasslands are dominated by perennial bunch grass species, whereas in warmer climates annual species form a greater component of the vegetation.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les prairies forment un biome terrestre qui regroupe les étendues herbacées au climat tempéré. Le paysage naturel est celui d'une immense étendue d'herbes dont les arbres sont le plus souvent complètement absents, sauf le long des cours d'eau.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Grasland bezeichnet man Gebiete, in denen niedrige Vegetation vorherrscht, die von Gräsern dominert wird.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Grasslands are areas where the vegetation is dominated by grasses (Poaceae) and other herbaceous (non-woody) plants (forbs). However, sedge (Cyperaceae) and rush (Juncaceae) families can also be found. Grasslands occur naturally on all continents except Antarctica. In temperate latitudes, such as northwest Europe and the Great Plains and California in North America, native grasslands are dominated by perennial bunch grass species, whereas in warmer climates annual species form a greater component of the vegetation.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Grasslands are areas where the vegetation is dominated by grasses (Poaceae) and other herbaceous (non-woody) plants (forbs). However, sedge (Cyperaceae) and rush (Juncaceae) families can also be found. Grasslands occur naturally on all continents except Antarctica. In temperate latitudes, such as northwest Europe and the Great Plains and California in North America, native grasslands are dominated by perennial bunch grass species, whereas in warmer climates annual species form a greater component of the vegetation.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Plains is the plural of plain, a geographical feature. It is a big flat area of a land.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une plaine est une forme particulière de relief, c'est un espace géographique caractérisé par une surface topographique plane, avec des pentes relativement faibles.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff 'Ebene' bezieht sich auf ein grösseres, flaches Gebiet Land.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Plains is the plural of plain, a geographical feature. It is a big flat area of a land.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Plains is the plural of plain, a geographical feature. It is a big flat area of a land.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A desert is a landscape or region that receives an extremely low amount of precipitation, less than enough to support growth of most plants. Deserts are defined as areas with an average annual precipitation of less than 250 millimetres (10 in) per year, or as areas where more water is lost by evapotranspiration than falls as precipitation. In the K0ppen climate classification system, deserts are classed as BWh (hot desert) or BWk (temperate desert). In the Thornthwaite climate classification system, deserts would be classified as arid megathermal climates.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le mot désert désigne aujourd'hui une zone stérile ou peu propice à la vie, en raison du sol impropre, ou de la faiblesse des précipitations (moins de 250 mm par an). Un paysage désertique se reconnaît à son aspect dénudé sur de vastes surfaces, sans présence humaine réellement importante.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Wüste ist ein Landstrich oder eine Region mit wenig Niederschlägen, wodurch kaum Wachstum von Pflanzen möglich ist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A desert is a landscape or region that receives an extremely low amount of precipitation, less than enough to support growth of most plants. Deserts are defined as areas with an average annual precipitation of less than 250 millimetres (10 in) per year, or as areas where more water is lost by evapotranspiration than falls as precipitation. In the K0ppen climate classification system, deserts are classed as BWh (hot desert) or BWk (temperate desert). In the Thornthwaite climate classification system, deserts would be classified as arid megathermal climates.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In physical geography, tundra is a biome where the tree growth is hindered by low temperatures and short growing seasons. The term tundra comes through Russian from the Kildin Sami word tundâr "uplands," "treeless mountain tract." There are three types of tundra: Arctic tundra, alpine tundra, and Antarctic tundra. In tundra, the vegetation is composed of dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens. Scattered trees grow in some tundra. The ecotone (or ecological boundary region) between the tundra and the forest is known as the tree line or timberline.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La toundra, terme emprunté au russe, lui-même emprunté au same désigne la formation végétale circumpolaire. Elle forme un cercle autour du pôle de plus de huit millions de km², soit 6 % des terres émergées. Du fait de la répartition des terres émergées sur la planète, la toundra n'existe pratiquement que dans l'hémisphère nord.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff 'Tundra' beschreibt eine Region in der ausgeprägtes Wachstum von Bäumen und Pflanzen durch niedrige Temperaturen und kurze Jahreszeiten mit klimatisch günstigen Bedingungen verhindert wird. Das Wort leitet sich aus dem Russischen ab, wo es soviel wie 'Nordland' bedeutet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]In physical geography, tundra is a biome where the tree growth is hindered by low temperatures and short growing seasons. The term tundra comes through Russian from the Kildin Sami word tundâr "uplands," "treeless mountain tract." There are three types of tundra: Arctic tundra, alpine tundra, and Antarctic tundra. In tundra, the vegetation is composed of dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens. Scattered trees grow in some tundra. The ecotone (or ecological boundary region) between the tundra and the forest is known as the tree line or timberline.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]In physical geography, tundra is a biome where the tree growth is hindered by low temperatures and short growing seasons. The term tundra comes through Russian from the Kildin Sami word tundâr "uplands," "treeless mountain tract." There are three types of tundra: Arctic tundra, alpine tundra, and Antarctic tundra. In tundra, the vegetation is composed of dwarf shrubs, sedges and grasses, mosses, and lichens. Scattered trees grow in some tundra. The ecotone (or ecological boundary region) between the tundra and the forest is known as the tree line or timberline.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A hill is a landform that extends above the surrounding terrain. Hills often have a distinct summit, although in areas with scarp/dip topography a hill may refer to a particular section of flat terrain without a massive summit (e.g. Box Hill).
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une colline est un relief généralement modéré et relativement peu étendu qui s'élève au-dessus d'une plaine ou d'un plateau et se distingue dans le paysage. Les collines peuvent être isolées ou se regrouper en champs de collines.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Hügel ist eine Landform, die sich über das umgebende Terrain erhebt, jedoch noch keinen massiven Gipfel, wie ein Berg vorweist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A hill is a landform that extends above the surrounding terrain. Hills often have a distinct summit, although in areas with scarp/dip topography a hill may refer to a particular section of flat terrain without a massive summit (e.g. Box Hill).
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A hill is a landform that extends above the surrounding terrain. Hills often have a distinct summit, although in areas with scarp/dip topography a hill may refer to a particular section of flat terrain without a massive summit (e.g. Box Hill).

TEXT.English: [TAB]Peak may refer to:A mountain peak, In topography, a summit is a point on a surface that is higher in elevation than all points immediately adjacent to it. Mathematically, a summit is a local maximum in elevation. The topographic terms "acme", "apex", "peak", and "zenith" are synonyms.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une montagne est une forme topographique de relief positif, à la surface de planètes telluriques (comme la Terre, Mars ou un satellite comme la Lune), et faisant partie d'un ensemble - une « chaîne de montagne » - ou formant un relief isolé.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Gipfel oder Berg bezeichnet man einen geographischen Punkt, der höher als alle umgebenden Geländepunkte ist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Peak may refer to:A mountain peak, In topography, a summit is a point on a surface that is higher in elevation than all points immediately adjacent to it. Mathematically, a summit is a local maximum in elevation. The topographic terms "acme", "apex", "peak", and "zenith" are synonyms.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Peak may refer to:A mountain peak, In topography, a summit is a point on a surface that is higher in elevation than all points immediately adjacent to it. Mathematically, a summit is a local maximum in elevation. The topographic terms "acme", "apex", "peak", and "zenith" are synonyms.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ice is water frozen into the solid state. Usually ice is the phase known as ice Ih, which is the most abundant of the varying solid phases on the Earth's surface. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter the appearance.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le permafrost, ou pergélisol, désigne la partie d'un sol gelé en permanence, au moins pendant deux ans, et de ce fait imperméable. Ses formations, persistance ou disparition, et son épaisseur sont très étroitement liées aux changements climatiques. C'est pourquoi le permafrost est étudié en tant qu'indicateur du réchauffement climatique par un réseau mondial de chercheurs s'appuyant sur des sondages, des mesures de température et un suivi satellitaire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Eis bezeichnet man gefrorenes und somit festes Wasser. Ein beachtlicher Teil der Wasservorräte der Erde liegt in Eisform vor.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ice is water frozen into the solid state. Usually ice is the phase known as ice Ih, which is the most abundant of the varying solid phases on the Earth's surface. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter the appearance.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Ice is water frozen into the solid state. Usually ice is the phase known as ice Ih, which is the most abundant of the varying solid phases on the Earth's surface. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter the appearance.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The coastline is where the land meets the sea or ocean. A precise line that can be called a coastline cannot be determined due to the dynamic nature of tides. The term "coastal zone" can be used instead, which is a spatial zone where interaction of the sea and land processes occurs. Both the terms coast and coastal are often used to describe a geographic location or region; for example, New Zealand's West Coast, or the East and West Coasts of the United States.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le littoral est la bande de terre qui sépare la zone comprise entre une étendue maritime et le continent, ou l'arrière-pays. Selon les échelles retenues, le littoral peut s'étendre de quelques centaines de mètres à plusieurs kilomètres de part et d'autre de la limite terre-eau ou au sens strict, correspondre à l'estran.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Küste bezeichnet man das Gebiet, wo Land auf Ozean trifft.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The coastline is where the land meets the sea or ocean. A precise line that can be called a coastline cannot be determined due to the dynamic nature of tides. The term "coastal zone" can be used instead, which is a spatial zone where interaction of the sea and land processes occurs. Both the terms coast and coastal are often used to describe a geographic location or region; for example, New Zealand's West Coast, or the East and West Coasts of the United States.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An ocean is a major body of saline water, and a principal component of the hydrosphere. Approximately 71% of the Earth's surface (3.6 x 10 8 km 2) is covered by ocean, a continuous body of water that is customarily divided into several principal oceans and smaller seas.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un océan est souvent défini, en géographie, comme une vaste étendue d'eau salée. En fait, il s'agit plutôt d'un volume, dont l'eau est en permanence renouvelée par des courants marins. Approximativement 70,7 % de la surface de la Terre est recouverte par l'océan mondial, communément divisé en cinq océans et en plusieurs dizaines de mers.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Ozean bezeichnet man einen grosse Wasserfläche mit Salzwasser. Ungefähr 71% ist mit Ozeanen bedeckt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]An ocean is a major body of saline water, and a principal component of the hydrosphere. Approximately 71% of the Earth's surface (3.6 x 10 8 km 2) is covered by ocean, a continuous body of water that is customarily divided into several principal oceans and smaller seas.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]An ocean is a major body of saline water, and a principal component of the hydrosphere. Approximately 71% of the Earth's surface (3.6 x 10 8 km 2) is covered by ocean, a continuous body of water that is customarily divided into several principal oceans and smaller seas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A marsh is a type of wetland that is dominated by herbaceous rather than woody plant species. Marshes can often be found at the edges of lakes and streams, where they form a transition between the aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems. They are often dominated by grasses, rushes or reeds. If woody plants are present they tend to be low-growing shrubs. This form of vegetation is what differentiates marshes from other types of wetland such as swamps, which are dominated by trees, and bogs, which are wetlands that have accumulated deposits of acidic peat.
TEXT.French: [TAB]En géographie, un marais est un type de formation paysagère au relief peu accidenté où le sol est recouvert, en permanence ou par intermittence, d'une couche d'eau stagnante, en général peu profonde, et couverte de végétations. On parle de zone humide.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Marsche bezeichnet man Feuchtgebiete, die eher von niedrigen Blattpflanzen als von Bäumen dominiert werden. Sie entstehen oft an angrenzenden Flüssen oder Seen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A marsh is a type of wetland that is dominated by herbaceous rather than woody plant species. Marshes can often be found at the edges of lakes and streams, where they form a transition between the aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems. They are often dominated by grasses, rushes or reeds. If woody plants are present they tend to be low-growing shrubs. This form of vegetation is what differentiates marshes from other types of wetland such as swamps, which are dominated by trees, and bogs, which are wetlands that have accumulated deposits of acidic peat.

If woody plants are present they tend to be low-growing shrubs. This form of vegetation is what differentiates marshes from other types of wetland such as swamps, which are dominated by trees, and bogs, which are wetlands that have accumulated deposits of acidic peat.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Prairies are ecosystems considered part of the temperate grasslands, savannas, and shrublands biome by ecologists, based on similar temperate climates, moderate rainfall, and a composition of grasses, herbs, and shrubs, rather than trees, as the dominant vegetation type. Temperate grassland regions include the Pampas of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay as well as the steppes of Eurasia. Lands typically referred to as "prairie" tend to be in North America. The term encompasses the area referred to as the Interior Lowlands of the United States, Canada and Mexico, which includes all of the Great Plains as well as the wetter, somewhat hillier land to the east. In the U.S., the area is constituted by most or all of the states of North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, and Oklahoma, and sizable parts of the states of Montana, Wyoming, Colorado, New Mexico, Texas, Missouri, Iowa, Illinois, Indiana, Wisconsin, and western and southern Minnesota. The Central Valley of California is also a prairie. The Canadian Prairies occupy vast areas of Manitoba, Saskatchewan, and Alberta.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La Prairie (anglais : Tallgrass Prairie) occupe les Grandes Plaines entre les Appalaches et les Montagnes Rocheuses. Cette écorégion à prairie de zone tempérée est constituée d'une flore herbeuse de graminées, de composées et de légumineuses. Son nom lui vient des explorateurs français et n'a pas été anglicisé. Elle est l'équivalent de la steppe en Eurasie et de la pampa en Amérique du Sud. Aux États-Unis et au Canada, on fait parfois la distinction entre la végétation de taille basse des Hautes Plaines à l'ouest du 104e méridien terrestre et la végétation de taille moyenne et haute de l'est (depuis le sud du Manitoba jusqu'au centre du Texas). Lorsque cette distinction est faite, il est habituel de limiter le mot "prairie" aux zones de végétation moyenne à haute. La plus grande partie de ce territoire a été convertie en zone cultivée au cours des deux cents dernières années.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Prairie bezeichnet man ein Gebiet, dass von Gräsern und Sträuchen dominiert ist, aber durch relativ hohe Temperaturen und vergleichsweise niedrige Niederschläge keinen starken Pflanzenbewuchs, wie beispielsweise die Savanne aufweist.

Temperate grassland regions include the Pampas of Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay as well as the steppes of Eurasia. Lands typically referred to as "prairie" tend to be in North America. The Central Valley of California is also a prairie. The Canadian Prairies occupy vast areas of Manitoba, Saskatchewan, and Alberta.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A savanna, or savannah, is a grassland ecosystem characterized by the trees being sufficiently widely spaced so that the canopy does not close. The open canopy allows sufficient light to reach the ground to support an unbroken herbaceous layer consisting primarily of grasses. Some classification systems also recognize a grassland savanna from which trees are absent. This article deals only with savanna under the common definition of a grassy woodland with a significant woody plant component. It is often believed that savannas feature widely spaced, scattered trees. However, in many savannas, tree densities are higher and trees are more regularly spaced than in forest. Savannas are also characterized by seasonal water availability, with the majority of rainfall confined to one season. Savannas are associated with several types of biomes. Savannas are frequently in a transitional zone between forest and desert or grassland. Savanna covers approximately 20% of the Earth's land area.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La savane est une formation végétale propre aux régions chaudes à longue saison sèche et dominée par les plantes herbacées de la famille des Poacées. Elle est plus ou moins parsemée d'arbres ou d'arbustes. Selon la densité (dans l'ordre croissant) des espèces ligneuses, on parle de savane herbeuse , de savane arbustive , de savane arborée , de savane boisée , puis de forêt claire, la transition se faisant en général de manière progressive.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Savanne bezeichnet man ein Grasgebiet, mit ausgeprägtem Bewuchs aber noch wenig Baumbestand und vergleichsweise hohen, wenn auch manchmal sehr saisonalen, Niederschlägen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]A savanna, or savannah, is a grassland ecosystem characterized by the trees being sufficiently widely spaced so that the canopy does not close. The open canopy allows sufficient light to reach the ground to support an unbroken herbaceous layer consisting primarily of grasses. Savannas are frequently in a transitional zone between forest and desert or grassland. Savanna covers approximately 20% of the Earth's land area.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A swamp is a wetland that is forested. Many swamps occur along large rivers, where they are critically dependent upon natural water level fluctuations. Other swamps occur on the shores of large lakes. Some swamps have hammocks, or dry-land protrusions, covered by aquatic vegetation, or vegetation that tolerates periodical inundation. The two main types of swamp are "true" or swamp forests and "transitional" or shrub swamps. In the boreal regions of Canada, the word swamp is colloquially used for what is more correctly termed a bog or muskeg. The water of a swamp may be fresh water, brackish water or seawater. Some of the world's largest swamps are found along major rivers such as the Amazon, the Mississippi, and the Congo. Conservationists have worked hard to preserve swamps. For example, the swamps in Northwest Indiana have been preserved as part of the Indiana Dunes.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un marécage désigne une zone recouverte de marais.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Unter einem Sumpf versteht man ein Feuchtgebiet mit Baumbewuschs. Sie entstehen oft an angrenzenden Flüssen oder Seen.

The two main types of swamp are "true" or swamp forests and "transitional" or shrub swamps. Some of the world's largest swamps are found along major rivers such as the Amazon, the Mississippi, and the Congo. Conservationists have worked hard to preserve swamps. For example, the swamps in Northwest Indiana have been preserved as part of the Indiana Dunes.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Polar Ice[COLOR_REVERT] is impassible terrain to all units. The only option you have is to sail around it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ice is water frozen into the solid state. Usually ice is the phase known as ice Ih, which is the most abundant of the varying solid phases on the Earth's surface. It can appear transparent or opaque bluish-white color, depending on the presence of impurities or air inclusions. The addition of other materials such as soil may further alter the appearance.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La banquise est la couche de glace qui se forme à la surface d'une étendue d'eau par solidification des premières couches d'eau, généralement la mer mais aussi les lacs et les rivières. Il ne faut pas confondre cette glace plus ou moins pérenne avec les calottes glaciaires et les inlandsis qui sont constitués quant à eux de glace continentale, c'est-à-dire de précipitations neigeuses accumulées et tassées.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Polareis[COLOR_REVERT] tritt nur auf dem Meer auf und ist für alle Schiffe unpassierbar. Diese müssen um diese herum segeln.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Als Eis bezeichnet man gefrorenes und somit festes Wasser. Ein beachtlicher Teil der Wasservorräte der Erde liegt in Eisform vor.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Jungles[COLOR_REVERT] grow on tropical latitudes, and your colonists can harvest [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_FRUITS]Cocoa Pods[\LINK] from it, as well as [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK]. Regular [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] is also provided by Jungles.[NEWLINE]Unlike Forests, a little [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] can be grown on Jungles by [LINK=PROFESSION_FARMER]Farmers[\LINK], if the underlying terrain is capable of producing at least 3 Food. [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COCOA_PLANTATION]Cocoa Plantations[\LINK] can be built in Jungles, building any other improvements will remove the Jungle.[NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] can plant Jungles on both [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Jungle or Tropical forest refers to the dense, more or less impenetrable tropical rainforest biome with an abundance of animal and plant life. The term jungle is technically a synonym to Tropical Rainforest. The word jungle originates from the Sanskrit word jangala which referred to uncultivated land. Although the Sanskrit word refers to "dry land", it has been suggested that an Anglo-Indian interpretation led to its connotation as a dense "tangled thicket". while others have argued that a cognate word in Urdu did refer to forests. The term is prevalent in many languages of South Asia, and Iranian plateau, particularly in Bangla, Hindi, Marathi, Urdu, Punjabi and Persian.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La jungle désigne les forêts de feuillus humides tropicales et subtropicales ou les forêts tropicales humides constituent un biome des zones intertropicales caractérisé par une formation végétale arborée haute et dense ainsi qu'un climat chaud et très humide.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Dschungel[COLOR_REVERT] wächst in tropischen Breitengraden. Die Kolonien können dort [LINK=YIELD_COCOA_FRUITS]Kakaofrüchte[\LINK] ernten, aber auch [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Edelholz[\LINK] schlagen. Normalse [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Holz[\LINK] ist im Dschungel natürlich ebenfalls vorhanden. [NEWLINE]Im Gegensatz zu anderen Wäldern, kann im Dschungel auch [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Nahrung[\LINK] geerntet werden, wenn das zugrunde liegende Gelände mindestens 3 Nahrung erzeugt. Im Dschungel können [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Holzfällerhütten[\LINK] und [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_COCOA_PLANTATION]Kakaoplantagen gebaut werden[\LINK]. Der Bau einer anderen Geländeverbesserung entfernt den Dschungel.[NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioniere[\LINK] können in [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Sümpfen[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannen[\LINK] neuen Dschungel anpflanzen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Dschungel oder Tropischer Wald bezieht sich aufgrund seiner Dichte auf einen mehr oder weniger undurchdringlichen Regenwald mit einer Vielzahl von Pflanzen und Tieren.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Jungle or Tropical forest refers to the dense, more or less impenetrable tropical rainforest biome with an abundance of animal and plant life. The term jungle is technically a synonym to Tropical Rainforest. The word jungle originates from the Sanskrit word jangala which referred to uncultivated land. Although the Sanskrit word refers to "dry land", it has been suggested that an Anglo-Indian interpretation led to its connotation as a dense "tangled thicket". while others have argued that a cognate word in Urdu did refer to forests. The term is prevalent in many languages of South Asia, and Iranian plateau, particularly in Bangla, Hindi, Marathi, Urdu, Punjabi and Persian.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In geography, an oasis (plural: oases) or cienega (Southwestern United States) is an isolated area of vegetation in a desert, typically surrounding a spring or similar water source. Oases also provide habitat for animals and even humans if the area is big enough. The location of oases has been of critical importance for trade and transportation routes in desert areas. Caravans must travel via oases so that supplies of water and food can be replenished. Thus, political or military control of an oasis has in many cases meant control of trade on a particular route. For example, the oases of Awjila, Ghadames and Kufra, situated in modern-day Libya, have at various times been vital to both North-South and East-West trade in the Sahara. The word oasis came into English via Greek oasis, borrowed directly from Egyptian or Demotic. It was not borrowed from Coptic, as is sometimes suggested; the Greek word is attested several centuries before Coptic existed as a written language.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une oasis (du grec ancien óasis) désigne, en géographie, une zone de végétation isolée dans un désert. Cela se produit à proximité d'une source d'eau ou lorsqu'une nappe phréatique est suffisamment proche de la surface du sol ou parfois sur le lit de rivières venant se perdre dans le désert.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Unter einer Oase versteht man eine isolierte Gegend mit Wasser und Vegetation, die von sehr trockenem Gebiet oder gar Wüste umschlossen ist. Sie stellen in diesen Gebieten Inseln des Lebens dar.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A floodplain, or flood plain, is a flat or nearly flat land adjacent to a stream or river that stretches from the banks of its channel to the base of the enclosing valley walls and experiences flooding during periods of high discharge. It includes the floodway, which consists of the stream channel and adjacent areas that carry flood flows, and the flood fringe, which are areas covered by the flood, but which do not experience a strong current.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une plaine inondable désigne le chenal où l'eau s'écoule avant débordement. Il peut être occupé en permanence ou de manière saisonnière. Le lit majeur, appelé aussi « plaine d'inondation » ou « lit d'inondation », est la partie adjacente au chenal d'écoulement d'un cours d'eau, qui n'est inondée qu'en cas de crue. La limite du lit majeur correspond au niveau de la plus grande crue historique enregistrée.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forests[COLOR_REVERT] grow in intermediate and high latitudes, and also on higher terrain in low latitudes. Your colonists can harvest [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Fur[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] from it.[NEWLINE]Forests prevents the winning of any other resources from its plot other than [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Ore[\LINK], unless a Bonus Resource is present.[LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Trapper Huts[\LINK] can be built in Forests, building any other improvements will remove the Forest.[NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] can plant Forests on both [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK] Terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A forest, also referred to as a wood or the woods and less often as a "wold" (or "weald"), "holt", or "frith" (or "firth"), is an area with a high density of trees. There are many definitions for forest, based on the various criteria. These plant communities cover approximately 9.4% of the Earth's surface (or 30% of total land area), though they once covered much more (about 50% of total land area), in many different regions and function as habitats for organisms, hydrologic flow modulators, and soil conservers, constituting one of the most important aspects of the Earth's biosphere. Although a forest is classified primarily by trees a forest ecosystem is defined intrinsically with additional species such as fungi.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Stratégie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forêt[COLOR_REVERT] pousse à des lattitudes intermédiaires. Le terrain permet de produire de la [LINK=YIELD_FUR]fourrure[\LINK] et du [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]bois de construction[\LINK].[NEWLINE]La forêt empêche la production de n'importe quelle autre bien à l'exception du [LINK=YIELD_ORE]minerai[\LINK], à part si une ressource bonus y est présente. Des [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]abris[\LINK] et des [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Huttes de trappeurs[\LINK] peuvent être construites dans la forêt.[NEWLINE]Les [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionniers[\LINK] peuvent planter de la forêt sur les terrains de [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]prairie[\LINK] et de [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Plaines[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]À savoir : Une forêt ou un massif forestier est une étendue boisée, relativement grande, constituée d'un ou plusieurs peuplements d'arbres et d'espèces associées. Un boisement de faible étendue est dit bois, boqueteau ou bosquet selon son importance. Divers types de forêts existent ; des forêts primaires aux forêts dites urbaines, avec les gradients intermédiaires. Il existe également de nombreux types d'exploitation des forêts (sylviculture, agrosylviculture). La forêt est aussi un milieu de vie et une source de revenus pour l'homme : au début du XXe siècle, plus de 500 millions de personnes, dont 150 millions d'autochtones vivent encore en forêt ou à ses abords. Elle abrite une grande richesse écologique composée d'une centaine d'espèces de mammifères, d'une cinquantaine d'espèces d'oiseaux, d'un millier d'espèces végétales et de plusieurs millions d'espèces d'insectes.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wald[COLOR_REVERT] wächst in gemässigten und nördlichen Breitengraden, aber auch in höheren Lagen der niedrigen Breitengrade. Die Kolonisten können dort [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Pelze[\LINK] gewinnen und [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Holz[\LINK] schlagen. Zur Gewinnung anderer Rohstoffe, ist Wald sehr schlecht geeignet. Es können [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Holzfällerhütten[\LINK] und [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Jagdhütten[\LINK] in Wäldern gebaut werden. Andere Geländeverbesserungen entfernen den Wald. [NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioniere[\LINK] können neue Wälder auf [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grasland[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK] pflanzen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Unter einem Wald versteht man ein Gebiet mit stark ausgeprägtem Baumbewuchs verschiendensten Alters. Die Dichte und die Baumarten und Pflanzenarten variieren von Region zu Region.

There are many definitions for forest, based on the various criteria. These plant communities cover approximately 9.4% of the Earth's surface (or 30% of total land area), though they once covered much more (about 50% of total land area), in many different regions and function as habitats for organisms, hydrologic flow modulators, and soil conservers, constituting one of the most important aspects of the Earth's biosphere. Although a forest is classified primarily by trees a forest ecosystem is defined intrinsically with additional species such as fungi.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taigas[COLOR_REVERT] grow predominantly 1n high latitudes, though they also may be found on higher terrain in low latitudes. Your colonists can harvest [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Fur[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]Premium Fur[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]Valuable Wood[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] from it.[NEWLINE]Taigas prevents the winning of any other resources from its plot other than [LINK=YIELD_ORE]Ore[\LINK], unless a Bonus Resource is present.[LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Trapper Huts[\LINK] can be built in Taigas, building any other improvements will remove the Taiga.[NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] can plant Taigas on [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK] Terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A forest, also referred to as a wood or the woods and less often as a "wold" (or "weald"), "holt", or "frith" (or "firth"), is an area with a high density of trees. There are many definitions for forest, based on the various criteria. These plant communities cover approximately 9.4% of the Earth's surface (or 30% of total land area), though they once covered much more (about 50% of total land area), in many different regions and function as habitats for organisms, hydrologic flow modulators, and soil conservers, constituting one of the most important aspects of the Earth's biosphere. Although a forest is classified primarily by trees a forest ecosystem is defined intrinsically with additional species such as fungi.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Stratégie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]La [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taïga[COLOR_REVERT] pousse principalement dans les climats de haute lattitude, bien qu'on puisse également la trouver dans les terrains très élevées de plus basse lattitutde. Le terrain permet de produire de la [LINK=YIELD_FUR]fourrure[\LINK], de la [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]fourrure de qualité[\LINK], du [LINK=YIELD_VALUABLE_WOOD]bois précieux[\LINK] et du [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]bois de construction[\LINK].[NEWLINE]La taïga empêche la production de n'importe quelle autre bien à l'exception du [LINK=YIELD_ORE]minerai[\LINK], à part si une ressource bonus y est présente. Des [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]abris[\LINK] et des [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Huttes de trappeurs[\LINK] peuvent être construites dans la taïga.[NEWLINE]Les [LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]pionniers[\LINK] peuvent planter de la taïga sur les terrains de [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]À savoir :[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] La taïga ou forêt boréale est l'un des principaux biomes terrestres. Fortement liée au climat subarctique, elle consiste en une formation végétale de type forestière parcourue par un vaste réseau lacustre résultant de l'érosion fluvioglaciaire. Sa végétation a la particularité d'être formée d'une majorité de conifères adaptés au froid (pins, épicéas, mélèzes et sapins), associée à un mélange de feuillus principalement composé de bouleaux, d'aulnes, de saules et de peupliers. Véritable désert humain, la taïga est la plus vaste continuité boisée de la planète et occupe à elle seule 10 % des terres émergées. Elle couvre la majorité des territoires intérieurs de l'Alaska, du Canada, de la Scandinavie, de la Finlande et de la Russie.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taiga[COLOR_REVERT] wächst in nördlichen Breitengraden, aber auch gelegentlich in höheren Lagen der gemässigten Breitengrade. Die Kolonisten können dort [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Pelze[\LINK] oder [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]Hochwertige Pelze[\LINK] gewinnen und [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Holz[\LINK] schlagen. Zur Gewinnung anderer Rohstoffe, ist Taiga sehr schlecht geeignet. Es können [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Holzfällerhütten[\LINK] und [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Jagdhütten[\LINK] in der Taiga gebaut werden. Andere Geländeverbesserungen entfernen den Wald. [NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioniere[\LINK] können neue Wälder auf [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Tundra[\LINK] pflanzen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Unter einem Wald versteht man ein Gebiet mit stark ausgeprägtem Baumbewuchs verschiendensten Alters. Die Dichte und die Baumarten und Pflanzenarten variieren von Region zu Region.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Light Forests[COLOR_REVERT] can grow on all latitudes. They slightly increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Fur[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Lumber[\LINK] from its plot, but it also retains all other yields the plot generates as a result of its base terrain, albeit in reduced numbers.[NEWLINE][LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Lodges[\LINK] and [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Trapper Huts[\LINK] can be built in Light Forests, building any other improvements will remove the Forest.[NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioneers[\LINK] cannot plant Light Forests anywhere. Once they're gone, they're gone for ever.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A forest, also referred to as a wood or the woods and less often as a "wold" (or "weald"), "holt", or "frith" (or "firth"), is an area with a high density of trees. There are many definitions for forest, based on the various criteria. These plant communities cover approximately 9.4% of the Earth's surface (or 30% of total land area), though they once covered much more (about 50% of total land area), in many different regions and function as habitats for organisms, hydrologic flow modulators, and soil conservers, constituting one of the most important aspects of the Earth's biosphere. Although a forest is classified primarily by trees a forest ecosystem is defined intrinsically with additional species such as fungi.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une forêt ou un massif forestier est une étendue boisée, relativement grande, constituée d'un ou plusieurs peuplements d'arbres et d'espèces associées. Un boisement de faible étendue est dit bois, boqueteau ou bosquet selon son importance. Les définitions de la forêt sont nombreuses en fonction des latitudes et des usages.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buschland[COLOR_REVERT] und lichte Wälder wachsen in allen Breitengraden. Die Kolonisten können dort ein wenig [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Felle[\LINK] gewinnen und auch etwas[LINK=YIELD_LUMBER]Holz[\LINK] schlagen. Die Gewinnung anderer Rohstoffe wird durch Buschland nur leicht behindert. Es können [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_LODGE]Holzfällerhütten[\LINK] und [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TRAPPER_HUT]Jagdhütten[\LINK] im Buschland gebaut werden. Andere Geländeverbesserungen entfernen den Wald. [NEWLINE][LINK=PROFESSION_PIONEER]Pioniere[\LINK] können kein neues Buschland pflanzen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Unter einem Wald versteht man ein Gebiet mit stark ausgeprägtem Baumbewuchs verschiendensten Alters. Die Dichte und die Baumarten und Pflanzenarten variieren von Region zu Region.
